medium: Pen and brown ink and brush and brown wash
creditline: Bequest of Dan Fellows Platt, Class of 1895
inscribed: in brown ink, on verso, center: Daudet | Ce 18 fevrier 1788. | Ce dessin provient de la vente de M. Chariot huissier | Commissaire priseur qui c'est faite [v'etre?] la fin de janvier | de la [...] . . . . . . . 251".1.s.

makers.displaydate: 1591–1666; born Cento, Italy; died Bologna, Italy
makers.displaymaker: Guercino (Giovanni Francesco Barbieri), 1591–1666; born Cento, Italy; died Bologna, Italy

texts.textentryhtml: According to biblical accounts, Christ was arrested by Roman soldiers at night in the Garden of Gethsemane after being betrayed by Judas. In this sketch for a lost painting, Guercino used economical means for maximum expression, combining elegant yet robust contours with subtly varied washes to convey the essence of the violent scene. Although no details of the setting are provided, flickering passages of light and shadow capture the nocturnal moment. A brilliant and versatile draftsman, Guercino produced thousands of brainstorming studies such as this for his paintings, most of them radically different from the final compositions.

Armand Frédéric Ernest Nogaret (1734-1806), sold in Paris, June 2, 1780 (no. 68). Antoine-Claude Chariot (1733-1815), sold in Paris, Jan 28, 1788 (no. 87). Alphonse Daudet (1840-1897). Parsons & Sons, London; purchased by Dan Fellows Platt (<font face="Helvetica">1873–1937) in 1923; <font face="Helvetica">bequeathed to Princeton University Art Museum, 1937.
</font></font>
